Salona(?) ---] / in ag[ro] p(edes) [---] / h(oc) s(epulcrum) h(eredem) [n(on) s(equetur)]
column20: Check inconsistencies in Tončinić2011; It is not commemorating a Leigo VII soldier, but one is mentioned. It commeorates S Julius Silvanus becoming first Aedile of colony at Aequum, a position which he seems to have been voted into by Legio VII veterans. Moreover, he is referred to as a quatrovir with judicial authority and pontifex powers.

column20: damaged inscription with the top half missing, and the first and alst letters illegible. Found in secondary use in Medieval cemetery. No other monument from Bigests-Ljubuški has the cpf title, however, the space where the title may have been on this stelae is obscured, so one can not completely disregard the possibility (hence the date): Tončinić 2011 makes this point.

column11: Here lies Gaius Aulius Secundus, son of Gaius, (registered in the voting tribe Aniensis, (from) the city of Cremona, veteran of legio VII Claudia pia fidelis. Arria Agathemeris made this for herself and her well-deserving husband, [and(?)] Quintus Arrius Priscus (?) [father or brother or patron]
column20: Now in secondary situ (in multiple pieces) inside a modern house. It was damaged during excvation, but is thought to have originally been in situ.
